data.text: Phone Holders: Flip the case to take the phone out -VS- Detach the whole case with the phone

Hello guys, I buy a new Giant. And I am looking for a phone mount with case to track my rides. I was wondering which type of the bundles is more convenient to take out the phone during cycling in case of calls or photography. A or B? Aï¼šflip case to take the phone out Bï¼šdetach a whole case with phone by unlocking the phone
Quad lock well recommended.
data.author: Craig Curtis

data.text: absolutely!
data.author: Rick Malthaner

data.text: B look into sincetop phone holder on ali express been using it for over 2 years now no issues and much cheaper then the quadlock
data.author: Menno Pieters

data.text: I like B becase it can take my phone off the mount much faster than A
data.author: Hyman Chen

data.text: Anything from Ali Express will not be truly waterproof. If it is. Post a link to it. . Quadlock is the best phone mount. Its not cheap. But it is the best. When it is raining my phone goes in my bag. I listen to directions with Aeropex headphones.
data.author: Steve Lindley

data.text: Yes, I agree.
data.author: Hyman Chen

data.text: Very happy with Quad lock used on many tours.
data.author: Anita Miller

data.text: Another vote for Quadlock - quality kit.
data.author: Phil Metcalfe

data.text: Is it like option B?
data.author: Hyman Chen

data.text: Vibrations and water damage a lot of electronics, it's amazing how quickly a thief can snatch whatever you have on your handlebars. Don't depend entirely on one device for all your tour navigation, pictures, communications, internet, and trip journal. More devices are better. FYI I carry a backup paper map and contact list. ðŸ™‚ If your tour is a few days then a phone would be more convenient but the risk is the same.
data.author: Clyde Slade

data.text: Thank you. I think the A option will prevent the phone from water damages. B option is faster to take out without flipping the cover.
data.author: Hyman Chen

data.text: Spend the money on QuadLock. It's worth it
data.author: Nathan Turnage

data.text: Is it like option B?
data.author: Hyman Chen

data.text: yes the QuadLock is the original, your option B is an imitation. Between the options you posted I would definitely choose B, not A.
data.author: Nathan Turnage

data.text: thank you
data.author: Hyman Chen

data.text: Quadloack
data.author: Grant Griffin

data.text: is it like option B?
data.author: Hyman Chen

data.text: different. Let me find the two we are using
data.author: Grant Griffin

data.text: I bought Garmin phone mount on eBay along with compatible piece for back of phone which I glued on. Perfect. All for under a tenner.
data.author: Jim Mullan

data.text: how do you take off the phone from the mount while there is a call or take pictures. is it convenient to do it?
data.author: Hyman Chen

data.text: yes, very easy. Just twists off and you're good to go
data.author: Jim Mullan

data.text: thank you
data.author: Hyman Chen

data.text: I concur on Quad Lock though they are not cheap.
data.author: Michael Noske

data.text: which type of the quadlock case refer to the above option?
data.author: Hyman Chen

data.text: Thank you for all your comments. I am Just confused which type you guys used the most, A or B? As a with a Flip cover and It can protect the phone for more, and B looks bulky, but it can be taken out the phone more quickly without fipping the cover.
data.author: Hyman Chen
